chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan P. Kessler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Per restitution hearing on 8/26/16 - Deft to pay towards restittion $20 per month.

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $270.16  plus surcharges***Deft to pay $20/month towards restitution.
May not have contact with Det Mognesen.  DOC shall promtply notify the court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

847   Clerk HM.   Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.    DE appears, in custody, with Atty DeFilippis.   Atty DeFilippis just received packet for restitution this morning.  DE previously stipulated to restitution in the amt of $207.16.   Amt of restitution requested today is $3,752.54 from ins co.   Atty DeFilippis objects to restitution claim.   Atty DeFilippis requests court make a finding that justice requires the ins co to be made whole - 973.20(5)(d) - payments made to insurer not victim.  Court requires testimony.       Marnie Roberts sworn in and testified.   Jonathan Kessler sworn in and testified - re: ability to pay.   DE will be released in just over three months.   Court hears argument.  Court orders restitution in the amt of $270.16 initially requested by victim, H.M. - no objection by DE.    Court will review full amt of restitution after RE's release from custody -  8/26 830am.   Ms. Roberts does not need to appear at next hearing is she dos not wish to appear.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Phan appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Rocco DeFilippis.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments heard.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year consecutive to 11CF883.  See conditions.  Restitution is ordered; deft requests restitution hrg.  Appeal rights.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Phan appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Rocco DeFilippis.  Deft's reconfinement hrg was not held due to his transportation down here for this hrg.  Reconfinement hrg will be heard sometime in November.  Defense wishes to proceed today.  Court adjourns this sentencing to 12/7/15 @ 2pm.
For Restitution Order

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Phan appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Rocco DeFilippis.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Count 2 is dismissed & read-in on State's motion.  Sentencing set over to 10/19/15 @ 3pm in order for the court to review the PSI from 11CF883.  In addition, the deft has not had his reconfinement hrg to date.  Deft stipulates to restitution in the amount of $270.16.

Email received from ADA Phan immediately following the 9/8/15 hrg requesting a new date for sentencing; she is unable on 10/19/15.  No objection from defense counsel.  Sentencing moved to 10/22/15 @ 11am

940.20(2) Battery of a Peace officer, Repeater   /   946.41(1) Obstructing, Repeater   /   947.01(1) DC, Repeater

Defendant Jonathan P. Kessler appeared with Attorney Rocco DeFilippis.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jennifer Ann Phan appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Arguments heard on Atty DeFilippis' motion to dismiss Cts 1 & 2; granted by The Court. Atty Phan indicates she will be filing an amended complaint. The Court modifies the bond to $2,500 signature bond with the same conditions. Matter adjourned.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
DE's Legal Memo in Support of Motion to Dismiss - filed by Atty DeFilippis
Regarding Acting in Official Capacity - filed by ADA Phan

Defendant Jonathan P. Kessler appeared with Attorney Rocco DeFilippis. Defendant in custody. Attorney Jennifer Ann Phan appeared for the Prosecution. Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Testimony from ST's witness: PPPD Detective Mogensen; cross-examination by Atty DeFilippis. ST moves for bind over; Atty DeFilippis objects and moves to dismiss Cts 1 & 2; arguments heard; The Court takes Atty DeFilippis' motion under advisement and instructs counsel to file memorandum regarding the motion. Matter adjourned, bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.
